definition: mastery of study lies in diligence (idiom). You can only master a subject by assiduous study./Excellence in work is only possible with diligence./Practice makes perfect.

diligent/industrious/hardworking/frequent/regular/constant

sentences.english: First Achievements, there is an old saying in Chinese called "industry specializing in ground transportation into Si."
sentences.chinese: 先说从艺，中国有句老话叫“业精于勤，行成于思”。

definition: study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
Heaven rewards the diligent. (idiom)
motto/maxim
to learn is to know one's ignorance (the Book of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])

definition: you get what you put in/you reap what you sow

definition: no end to learning (idiom); There's always something new to study./You live and learn.
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently

related.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way

studious/diligent in study
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
